page.title: 17BANK HOUSE,KETLEY BANK
page.content:
This is a historic listed building. It was built by Richard Hartshorne in 1721 on land that belonged to the{Duke {of Sutherland.}Most of the land in this area belonged to the Duke of Sutherland. It was a mining area and most of the old mine shafts can still be seen.
In 1789{William Reynolds}came to live at Bank House. He was the son of the unlucky Hannah Darby who died of measles when William was 4. The house is supposed to be haunted by Hannah who was the daughter of Abraham Darby II.
By 1777, when William Reynolds was 19, he was said to be carrying out experiments. His interests lay in glass,steel and tar. Later he built a laboratory at Bank House.
